1.verse: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of the elect of God and the acknowledging of the truth, which is according to godliness:

2.verse: Unto the hope of life everlasting, which God, who lieth not, hath promised before the times of the world:

3.verse: But hath in due times manifested his word in preaching, which is committed to me according to the commandment of God our Savior:

4.verse: To Titus my beloved son, according to the common faith, grace and peace from God the Father, and from Christ Jesus our Savior.

5.verse: For this cause I left thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and shouldest ordain priests in every city, as I also appointed thee:

6.verse: If any be without crime, the husband of one wife, having faithful children, not accused of riot, or unruly.

7.verse: For a bishop must be without crime, as the steward of God: not proud, not subject to anger, not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre:

8.verse: But given to hospitality, gentle, sober, just, holy, continent:

9.verse: Embracing that faithful word which is according to doctrine, that he may be able to exhort in sound doctrine, and to convince the gainsayers.

10.verse: For there are also many disobedient, vain talkers, and seducers: especially they who are of the circumcision:

11.verse: Who must be reproved, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre's sake.

12.verse: One of them a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are always liars, evil beasts, slothful bellies.

13.verse: This testimony is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

14.verse: Not giving heed to Jewish fables and commandments of men, who turn themselves away from the truth.

15.verse: All things are clean to the clean: but to them that are defiled, and to unbelievers, nothing is clean: but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.

16.verse: They profess that they know God: but in their works they deny him; being abominable, and incredulous, and to every good work reprobate.

1.verse: But speak thou the things that become sound doctrine:

2.verse: That the aged men be sober, chaste, prudent, sound in faith, in love, in patience.

3.verse: The aged women, in like manner, in holy attire, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teaching well:

4.verse: That they may teach the young women to be wise, to love their husbands, to love their children,

5.verse: To be discreet, chaste, sober, having a care of the house, gentle, obedient to their husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

6.verse: Young men, in like manner, exhort that they be sober.

7.verse: In all things shew thyself an example of good works, in doctrine, in integrity, in gravity,

8.verse: The sound word that can not be blamed: that he, who is on the contrary part, may be afraid, having no evil to say of us.

9.verse: Exhort servants to be obedient to their masters, in all things pleasing, not gainsaying:

10.verse: Not defrauding, but in all things shewing good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things:

11.verse: For the grace of God our Savior hath appeared to all men;

12.verse: Instructing us, that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live soberly, and justly, and godly in this world,

13.verse: Looking for the blessed hope and coming of the glory of the great God and our Savior Jesus Christ,

14.verse: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and might cleanse to himself a people acceptable, a pursuer of good works.

15.verse: These things speak, and exhort and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.

1.verse: Admonish them to be subject to princes and powers, to obey at a word, to be ready to every good work.

2.verse: To speak evil of no man, not to be litigious, but gentle: shewing all mildness towards all men.

3.verse: For we ourselves also were some time unwise, incredulous, erring, slaves to divers desires and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

4.verse: But when the goodness and kindness of God our Savior appeared:

5.verse: Not by the works of justice, which we have done, but according to his mercy, he saved us, by the laver of regeneration, and renovation of the Holy Ghost;

6.verse: Whom he hath poured forth upon us abundantly, through Jesus Christ our Savior:

7.verse: That, being justified by his grace, we may be heirs, according to hope of life everlasting.

8.verse: It is a faithful saying: and these things I will have thee affirm constantly: that they, who believe in God, may be careful to excel in good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

9.verse: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law. For they are unprofitable and vain.

10.verse: A man that is a heretic, after the first and second admonition, avoid:

11.verse: Knowing that he, that is such an one, is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned by his own judgment.

12.verse: When I shall send to thee Artemas or Tychicus, make haste to come unto me to Nicopolis. For there I have determined to winter.

13.verse: Send forward Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollo, with care, that nothing be wanting to them.

14.verse: And let our men also learn to excel in good works for necessary uses: that they be not unfruitful.

15.verse: All that are with me salute thee: salute them that love us in the faith. The grace of God be with you all. Amen.
